models.name: FlowId
models.doc: Identifier for a Gobblin as a Service flow

fields.name: flowGroup
fields.doc: Group of the flow. This defines the namespace for the flow.

models.name: Schedule
models.doc: Attributes for defining a job schedule

fields.name: cronSchedule
fields.doc: Schedule for flow in cron format

fields.name: runImmediately
fields.doc: Set to true to request that a job with a schedule be run immediately in addition to being scheduled

models.name: FlowConfig
models.doc: Defines a flow configuration that can be compiled into Gobblin jobs

fields.name: schedule
fields.doc: Optional schedule for when to execution the flow. If a schedule is not specified then the flow is executed immediately.

fields.name: templateUris
fields.doc: Comma separated list of URIs for templates used in the flow. The template location is defined by the multiproduct that packages the template.

fields.name: properties
fields.doc: Properties for the flow. These properties are passed to the compiled Gobblin jobs.

models.name: EmptyRecord
models.doc: An literally empty record.  Intended as a marker to indicate the absence of content where a record type is required.  If used the underlying DataMap *must* be empty, EmptyRecordValidator is provided to help enforce this.  For example,  CreateRequest extends Request<EmptyRecord> to indicate it has no response body.   Also, a ComplexKeyResource implementation that has no ParamKey should have a signature like XyzResource implements ComplexKeyResource<XyzKey, EmptyRecord, Xyz>.

schema.name: flowconfigs
schema.doc:
Resource for handling flow configuration requests

generated from: org.apache.gobblin.service.FlowConfigsResource

methods.doc: Create a flow configuration that the service will forward to execution instances for execution
Retrieve the flow configuration with the given key

Update the flow configuration with the specified key. Running flows are not affected.
 An error is raised if the flow configuration does not exist.
Delete a configured flow. Running flows are not affected. The schedule will be removed for scheduled flows.
